module.name: LCLType
module.short: Provides compatibility with the Delphi Windows unit.

descr.p: lcltype.pp was created specifically for compatibility with Delphi. It should only be used for constants and type definitions that are included in the Delphi Windows unit. This is done only for compatibility.

element.name: TUTF8Char
element.short: A type that can hold an UTF-8 encoded character.

element.name: UINT
element.short: A 32-bit unsigned integer.

element.name: UINT_PTR
element.short: Unsigned integer type with same size as Pointer.

element.name: TTranslateString
element.short: Alias for the String type.

descr.p: TTranslateString is the type used to represent string values that can be translated using the localization facilities found in the LCL and the Lazarus IDE. Properties, constants, variables, and parameter values defined using this type can be localized using translation classes found in the lcltranslator unit.

element.name: TCriticalSection
element.short: Alias for the PtrUInt type.

descr.p: TCriticalSection is the type used to protect access to resources in a multi-threaded application. Please note that the type is different than the TRTLCriticalSection type and the class by the same name implemented in the syncobjs unit in the FPC RTL (Run-Time Library).

element.name: TDockImageOperation
element.short: Actions occurring while dragging an image.

element.name: TDockImageOperation.disShow
element.short: Show the image.

element.name: TDockImageOperation.disMove
element.short: Move the already visible image.

element.name: TDockImageOperation.disHide
element.short: Hide the image.

element.name: THandle
element.short: Deprecated. Alias to the PtrUInt type.

descr.p: Defined for platforms other than Windows. Needed because THandle in the RTL SysUtils unit is defined as longint.

element.version: THandle has been deprecated in LCL version 4.0 (July 2023). Use the TLCLHandle type instead.

element.name: HKEY
element.short: Handle to a registry key.

element.name: HDC
element.short: The type for a Device Context Handle.

element.name: HHOOK
element.short: Handle for a callback routine.

element.name: HFONT
element.short: The type of a Font Handle.

element.name: HGDIOBJ
element.short: The type of a general GraphicsDeviceInterface Object Handle.
element.descr: GDI objects are e.g. fonts or brushes, used in GDI drawing operations.

element.name: HPEN
element.short: The type of a line drawing Pen Handle.

element.name: HRGN
element.short: The type of a display Region Handle.

descr.p: A region can be as simple as a rectangle, or can be composed of multiple shapes.
Regions are almost used to restrict painting to certain areas of the screen (clipping).

element.name: HINST
element.short: The type of a (process) Instance Handle.

element.name: HICON
element.short: The type of an Icon Handle.

element.name: HIMAGELIST
element.short: The type of an Image List Handle.

descr.p: Image lists are frequently used with controls, whose display items (list entries...) can also show an image. Then every item refers to its image by an index into the shared image list, instead of holding a copy of the image.

element.name: HCURSOR
element.short: The type for a mouse Cursor Handle.

element.name: HGLOBAL
element.short: The type for a Global memory block Handle.
element.descr: Global memory blocks are managed by the platform, used e.g. for data shared across multiple processes.

element.name: HWND
element.short: The type of a Window Handle.

descr.p: Windows are managed by the platform's window manager. A window can be stand-alone (TForm) or embedded (TWinControl).

element.name: HMENU
element.short: The type of a Menu Handle.

element.name: HBITMAP
element.short: The type of a Bitmap Handle.

element.name: HPALETTE
element.short: The type of a color Palette Handle.
element.descr: A color palette is frequently used in compressed bitmaps, which contain short (1..8 bit) palette indices instead of RGB colors, for every pixel.

element.name: HBRUSH
element.short: The type of a painting Brush Handle.
element.descr: A brush is used to fill image areas. Typical brush properties are color, pattern and fill style.

element.name: HMONITOR
element.short: The type of a display Monitor (CRT...) Handle.

element.name: Bool
element.short: A LongBool type, distinct from the Boolean type.

element.name: Short
element.short: A SmallInt type.

element.name: PRect
element.short: A pointer to TRect.

element.name: WPARAM
element.short: Type of the first message argument (pointer-sized).

element.name: LPARAM
element.short: Type of the second message argument (pointer-sized).

element.name: LRESULT
element.short: Type of a message result (pointer-sized).

element.name: ULONG_PTR
element.short: Alias for the PtrUInt type.

element.name: TLCLIntfHandle
element.short: Deprecated. Alias for the TLCLHandle type.

descr.p: TLCLIntfHandle is the type returned from the CreateHandle method in widgetset classes.

element.version: TLCLIntfHandle has been deprecated in LCL version 4.0. Use the TLCLHandle type instead.

element.name: INVALID_HANDLE_VALUE
element.short: Value representing an invalid (unassigned) Handle.

element.name: MaxByte
element.short: Maximum value for the WinAPI BYTE type ($FF).

element.name: MAXWORD
element.short: Maximum value for the WinAPI WORD type ($FFFF).

element.name: MAXDWORD
element.short: Maximum value for the WinAPI DWORD type ($FFFF FFFF).

element.name: MINCHAR
element.short: Minimum value for the WinAPI CHAR type ($80).

element.name: MAXCHAR
element.short: Maximum value for the WinAPI CHAR type ($7F).

element.name: MINSHORT
element.short: Minimum value for the WinAPI SHORT type ($8000).

element.name: MAXSHORT
element.short: Maximum value for the WinAPI SHORT type ($7FFF).

element.name: MINLONG
element.short: Minimum value for the WinAPI LONG type ($8000 0000).

element.name: MAXLONG
element.short: Maximum value for the WinAPI LONG type ($7FFF FFFF).

element.name: R2_BLACK
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): all black.

element.name: R2_NOTMERGEPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): not (Dst or Pen).

element.name: R2_MASKNOTPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): Dst and not Pen.

element.name: R2_NOTCOPYPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): not Pen.

element.name: R2_MASKPENNOT
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): (not Dst) and Pen.

element.name: R2_NOT
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): not Dst.

element.name: R2_XORPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): Dst xor Pen.

element.name: R2_NOTMASKPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): not (Dst and Pen).

element.name: R2_MASKPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): Dst and Pen.

element.name: R2_NOTXORPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): not (Dst xor Pen).

element.name: R2_NOP
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): Dst.

element.name: R2_MERGENOTPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): Dst or not Pen.

element.name: R2_COPYPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): Pen.

element.name: R2_MERGEPENNOT
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): (not Dst) or Pen.

element.name: R2_MERGEPEN
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): Dst or Pen.

element.name: R2_WHITE
element.short: Binary raster operation (Dst op Pen): all white.

element.name: R2_LAST
element.short: Highest binary raster operation code.

element.name: SRCCOPY
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with Src.

element.name: SRCPAINT
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (Dst or Src).

element.name: SRCAND
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (Dst and Src).

element.name: SRCINVERT
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (Dst xor Src).

element.name: SRCERASE
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with ((not Dst) and Src).

element.name: NOTSRCCOPY
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (not Src).

element.name: NOTSRCERASE
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (not (Dst or Src)).

element.name: MERGECOPY
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (Src and Pattern).

element.name: MERGEPAINT
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (Dst or not Src).

element.name: PATCOPY
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (Pattern).

element.name: PATPAINT
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (Dst or (not Src) or Pattern).

element.name: PATINVERT
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (Dst xor Pattern).

element.name: DSTINVERT
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with (not Dst).

element.name: BLACKNESS
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with all black.

element.name: WHITENESS
element.short: Ternary raster operation (Dst op Src op Pattern): Fills the destination area with all white.

element.name: TKeyBoardState
element.short: State array of 256 possible (virtual) keys.

element.name: _ABC
element.short: Record describing the width of a TrueType character.

descr.p: The effective display width for a single character is A+B+C.
The width of multiple characters should exclude the first A and last C value.
Negative A and C values allow for underhangs or overhangs, e.g. italics.

element.name: _ABC.abcA
element.short: The (possibly negative) distance to add to the current position before drawing the character glyph.

element.name: _ABC.abcB
element.short: The width of the character glyph.

element.name: _ABC.abcC
element.short: The (possibly negative) distance to add to the current position after drawing the character glyph.

element.name: ETO_OPAQUE
element.short: Opaque ExtTextOut mode, filling the rectangle with the background Color before painting the text.

element.name: ETO_CLIPPED
element.short: Clipped ExtTextOut mode, clipping the text at the rectangle boundaries.

element.name: CS_VREDRAW
element.short: Class style constant used to redraw the entire window when the height for the client area has been changed.

element.name: CS_HREDRAW
element.short: Class style constant used to redraw the entire window when the width for the client area has been changed.

element.name: RGN_AND
element.short: CombineRgn mode: intersection (r1 AND r2).

element.name: RGN_OR
element.short: CombineRgn mode: union (r1 OR r2).

element.name: RGN_XOR
element.short: CombineRgn mode: logical difference (r1 XOR r2).

element.name: RGN_DIFF
element.short: CombineRgn mode: arithmetic difference (r1 - r2).

element.name: RGN_COPY
element.short: CombineRgn mode: copy of r1.

element.name: DT_TOP
element.short: DrawText formatting: text justified to the top of the rectangle.

element.name: DT_LEFT
element.short: DrawText formatting: text justified to the left of the rectangle.

element.name: DT_CENTER
element.short: DrawText formatting: text centered horizontally within the rectangle.

element.name: DT_RIGHT
element.short: DrawText formatting: text justified to the right of the rectangle.

element.name: DT_VCENTER
element.short: DrawText formatting: text centered vertically within the rectangle.

element.name: DT_BOTTOM
element.short: DrawText formatting: text justified to the bottom of the rectangle.

element.name: DT_WORDBREAK
element.short: DrawText formatting: text can wrap into multiple lines.

element.name: DT_SINGLELINE
element.short: DrawText formatting: text is drawn in a single line, regardless of embedded line endings.

element.name: DT_EXPANDTABS
element.short: DrawText formatting: expand tab characters.

element.name: DT_NOCLIP
element.short: DrawText formatting: text is drawn without clipping.

element.name: DT_CALCRECT
element.short: DrawText formatting: returns the required rectangle, without actually drawing.

element.name: DT_NOPREFIX
element.short: DrawText formatting: show embedded '&' characters.

element.name: DT_INTERNAL
element.short: DrawText formatting: uses the system font for calculations.

element.name: DT_EDITCONTROL
element.short: DrawText formatting: emulates the behavior of a multi-line edit control.

element.name: DT_END_ELLIPSIS
element.short: DrawText formatting: appends an ellipsis when the text is truncated.

element.name: DT_MODIFYSTRING
element.short: DrawText formatting: update the string to match the displayed text (possibly truncated).

element.name: DT_RTLREADING
element.short: DrawText formatting: use right-to-left reading layout for bidirectional text.

element.name: DT_HIDEPREFIX
element.short: DrawText formatting flag: Ignore the accelerator key prefix (&) and hide the underline.

element.name: DT_PREFIXONLY
element.short: DrawText formatting flag: Draw only the underlined accelerator key, ignore any other text.

element.name: DFCS_SCROLLDOWN

element.short: DrawFrameControl button control style: flat.

element.name: HTERROR
element.short: Hit test error (like HTNOWHERE) which produces a system beep.

element.name: HTTRANSPARENT
element.short: Hit test: transparent area.

element.name: HTNOWHERE
element.short: Hit test: outside control.

element.name: HTCLIENT
element.short: Hit test: client area.

element.name: HTCAPTION
element.short: Hit test: caption background.

element.name: MSGF_DIALOGBOX
element.short: Indicates an input event occurred in a dialog.

element.name: MSGF_MESSAGEBOX
element.short: Indicates an input event occurred in a message box.

element.name: MSGF_MENU
element.short: Indicates an input event occurred in a menu.

element.name: MSGF_MOVE
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: MSGF_SIZE
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: MSGF_SCROLLBAR
element.short: Indicates an input event occurred in a scroll bar.

element.name: MSGF_NEXTWINDOW
element.short: Indicates an ALT+TAB input event occurred to activate the next window.

element.name: PM_Noremove
element.short: PeekMessage flag: don't remove peeked message.

element.name: PM_Remove
element.short: PeekMessage flag: remove peeked message.

element.name: MF_BYCOMMAND
element.short: Find menu item by command ID.

element.name: MF_BYPOSITION
element.short: Find menu item by position number.

element.name: MF_SEPARATOR
element.short: Menu flag to draw a horizontal separator.

element.name: MF_ENABLED
element.short: Menu flag to enable a menu item for selection.

element.name: MF_GRAYED
element.short: Menu flag to disable a menu item and prevent its selection.

element.name: MF_DISABLED
element.short: Menu flag to disable a menu item and prevent its selection, but it does not gray the menu item.

element.name: MF_UNCHECKED
element.short: Menu to flag to draw the item without a check mark, even when a bitmap is supplied for the menu item.

element.name: MF_CHECKED
element.short: Menu flag to draw a check mark for the menu item.

element.name: MF_USECHECKBITMAPS
element.short: Menu flag to enable check mark bitmaps for menu items.

element.name: MF_STRING
element.short: Menu flag which specifies a menu item as a text value.

element.name: MF_BITMAP
element.short: Menu flag which specifies a menu item as a bitmap image.

element.name: MF_OWNERDRAW
element.short: Menu flag which specified the menu item is owner-drawn. Indicates that WM_MEASUREITEM and WM_DRAWITEM messages are used when the menu item is updated.

element.name: MF_POPUP
element.short: Menu flag which specifies the menu item is a a pop-up, drop-down, or sub-menu.

element.name: MF_MENUBARBREAK
element.short: Menu flag, like MF_MENUBREAK, but used for a menu bar. Causes a menu, sub-menu, or short cut to be displayed in a new column with a vertical separator.

element.name: MF_MENUBREAK
element.short: Menu flag, like MF_MENUBARBREAK, but used for a menu item. Causes the new menu item to appear on a separate line (menu bar) or column (menu, sub-menu, or short cut) without a separator line.

element.name: MF_UNHILITE
element.short: Menu flag used to remove highlighting from a menu item.

element.name: MF_HILITE
element.short: Menu flag used to add highlighting to a menu item. When omitted, the MF_UNHILITE menu flag is assumed.

element.name: MF_DEFAULT
element.short: Menu flag used to indicate that an item is the default selection for a menu.

element.name: MF_SYSMENU
element.short: Menu flag which indicates if the menu item appears on the Window menu.

element.name: MF_HELP
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: MF_RIGHTJUSTIFY
element.short: Menu flag which indicates the menu item caption is right aligned.

element.name: MF_MOUSESELECT
element.short: Menu flag which indicates the item has been selected using the mouse.

element.name: MF_UNSUPPORTED
element.short: Mask used to filter menu flag values.

element.name: KF_EXTENDED
element.short: Focus and activation key flag used to test for extended key values.

element.name: KF_DLGMODE
element.short: Focus and activation key flag which indicates if a dialog is active.

element.name: KF_MENUMODE
element.short: Focus and activation key flag which indicates if a menu is active.

element.name: KF_ALTDOWN
element.short: Focus and activation key flag which indicates if the Alt key is pressed.

element.name: KF_REPEAT
element.short: Focus and activation key flag used to manipulate the previous key state flag.

element.name: KF_UP
element.short: Focus and activation key flag used to manipulate a key state transition flag.

element.name: scMeta
element.short: Represents the Meta key in a short cut value.

element.name: VK_UNKNOWN
element.short: Virtual key code for an unknown key (defined by the LCL).

element.name: VK_LBUTTON
element.short: Virtual key code (Windows API compatible).

element.name: VK_RBUTTON
element.short: Virtual key code (Windows API compatible).

element.name: VK_CANCEL
element.short: Virtual key code (Windows API compatible).

element.name: VK_MBUTTON
element.short: Virtual key code for the middle mouse button (Windows API compatible).

element.name: VK_XBUTTON1
element.short: Virtual key code for the first extra mouse button (Windows API compatible).

element.name: VK_XBUTTON2
element.short: Virtual key code for the second extra mouse button (Windows API compatible).

element.name: VK_BACK
element.short: Virtual key code for the Backspace key. Not to be confused with the Android BACK navigation key which is mapped to VK_ESCAPE.

descr.p: Not equivalent to anything less than $FF. Will only be sent by a primary "@" key but not for a @ key as secondary action of a "2" key, for example.

element.name: BDR_RAISEDOUTER
element.short: Represents a 3-D border style with a raised outer border.

element.name: BDR_SUNKENOUTER
element.short: Represents a 3-D border style with a sunken outer border.

element.name: BDR_RAISEDINNER
element.short: Represents a 3-D border style with a raised inner border.

element.name: BDR_SUNKENINNER
element.short: Represents a 3-D border style with a sunken inner border.

element.name: BDR_OUTER
element.short: Indicates whether an outer border (raised or sunken) is in use for a control.

element.name: BDR_INNER
element.short: Indicates whether an inner border (raised or sunken) is in use for a control.

element.name: BDR_RAISED
element.short: Indicates whether a raised border (inner or outer) is in use for a control.

element.name: BDR_SUNKEN
element.short: Indicates whether a sunken border (inner or outer) is in use for a control.

element.name: EDGE_BUMP

element.name: EDGE_ETCHED
element.short: Combination of BDR_SUNKENOUTER and BDR_RAISEDINNER.

element.name: EDGE_RAISED
element.short: Combination of BDR_RAISEDOUTER and BDR_RAISEDINNER.

element.name: EDGE_SUNKEN
element.short: Combination of BDR_SUNKENOUTER and BDR_SUNKENINNER.

element.name: BF_LEFT
element.short: Border flag representing the left side of a border rectangle.

element.short: Border flag representing the top edge of a border rectangle.

element.name: BF_RIGHT
element.short: Border flag representing the right side of a border rectangle.

element.name: BF_BOTTOM
element.short: Border flag representing the bottom edge of a border rectangle.

element.name: BF_TOPLEFT

element.name: BF_TOPRIGHT

element.name: BF_BOTTOMLEFT
element.short: Border flag representing the bottom and left sides of a border rectangle.

element.name: BF_BOTTOMRIGHT

element.name: BF_RECT

element.name: BF_DIAGONAL
element.short: Border flag representing a diagonal border.

element.name: BF_DIAGONAL_ENDTOPRIGHT
element.short: Border flag representing a diagonal border where the origin is the bottom-left corner and the terminus is the top-right corner of the rectangle.

element.name: MB_OK
element.short: Indicates a message box includes an Ok button.

element.name: MB_OKCANCEL
element.short: Indicates a message box includes Ok and Cancel buttons.

element.name: MB_ABORTRETRYIGNORE

element.name: MB_YESNOCANCEL
element.short: Indicates a message box includes Yes, No, and Cancel buttons.

element.name: MB_YESNO

element.name: MB_RETRYCANCEL
element.short: Indicates a message box includes Retry and Cancel buttons.

element.name: MB_CANCELTRYCONTINUE
element.short: Indicates a message box includes Cancel, Retry, and Continue buttons.

descr.p: Not yet supported by MessageDlg.

element.name: MB_HELP
element.short: Indicates a message box includes a Help button.

descr.p: Not yet supported by MessageDlg.

element.name: MB_ICONHAND

element.name: MB_ICONQUESTION
element.short: Indicates that a message box displays a Question Mark icon.

element.name: MB_ICONEXCLAMATION
element.short: Indicates that a message box displays an Exclamation Point icon.

element.name: SIF_Range

element.name: SIF_PAGE
element.short: Request for the scrollbar page size.

element.name: SIF_POS
element.short: Request for the scrollbar position.

element.name: SIF_DISABLENOSCROLL
element.short: Disable the scrollbar if not needed.

element.name: SIF_TRACKPOS
element.short: Request for the scrollbar tracking position.

element.name: SIF_ALL
element.short: Request all scrollbar properties.

descr.p: Defined for the LCL.

element.name: tagScrollInfo
element.short: The Scrollbar properties parameter record.

descr.p: This record is used with the GetScrollInfo and SetScrollInfo procedures. before every call fMask must be initialized with the flags for the desired values:

ul.li: SIF_DISABLENOSCROLL: when the new parameters make the scrollbar unnecessary, the scrollbar is only disabled, not removed. (write only)
SIF_PAGE: nPage contains the page size.
SIF_POS: nPos contains the slider position.
SIF_RANGE: nMin and nMax contain the scroll limits.
SIF_TRACKPOS: nTrackPos contains the current slider position, while the user is dragging the slider. (read only)

element.name: tagScrollInfo.cbSize
element.short: Must be initialized to sizeof(TScrollInfo).

element.short: The page size, equivalent to the slider size.

element.name: tagScrollInfo.nPos
element.short: The slider position.

element.name: tagScrollInfo.nTrackPos
element.short: The current position while the user is dragging the slider.

element.name: COLORREF
element.short: Represents color constants in the LCL.

descr.p: COLORREF is the type used for color constants defined in the LCL. It is interchangeable with the TColorRef type; COLORREF is an alias for TColorRef in the RTL System.UITypes unit.

The base type used for the definition is dependent on the compiler version used to build the LCL. Starting in FPC version 3.2.3, the base type is the TColorRef type defined in the System.UITypes namespace in the FPC run-time library (RTL).
Values in COLORREF (and TColorRef) are normally OR-ed with the value $80000000 to prevent interference with other MS color enumeration values.

element.name: TColorRef
element.short: Represents color constants in the LCL.

descr.p: TColorRef is an alias for the COLORREF type, and is used for color constants defined in the LCL.

Values from 0..$FFFFFF are BGR colors. The lowest 8 bit are the blue component, the middle 8 bit the green component and the highest 8 bit the red component. Use the functions Red, Green, Blue to extract the components, RedGreenBlue to extract all three components and RGBToColor to convert the three colors to a TColor.

Values with highest bit set are system colors or themed colors. For example clNone, clBackground, clButton, clWindowText. Their actual value depend on the context (i.e. the used Canvas) and they are not valid in all contexts. For example clWindowText might only work for Font.Color, not for Brush.Color or Pen.Color. clBackground might be a color, gradient, pattern or image, depending on theme and control type.

A system color can change during run-time, so do not store them. Use system colors only on LCL control Canvas. They probably are not defined for printer canvas and some are not defined on bitmap canvas.

element.short: System metric index used to get the width in pixels of the screen for the primary display monitor.

element.name: SM_CYBORDER

element.name: SM_CYDLGFRAME
