element.name: SM_CXHTHUMB
element.short: System metric index used to get the width for the thumb box (in pixels) in a horizontal scroll bar.

element.name: SM_CXICON
element.short: System metric index used to get the width (in pixels) for a large icon.

element.name: SM_CYICON
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for a large icon.

element.name: SM_CXCURSOR
element.short: System metric index used to get the width (in pixels) for a cursor shape.

element.name: SM_CYCURSOR
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for a cursor shape.

element.name: SM_CYMENU
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for a single-line menu bar.

element.name: SM_CXFULLSCREEN
element.short: System metric index used to get the width (in pixels) for the client area in a full-screen window on the primary display.

element.name: SM_CYFULLSCREEN
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for the client area in a full-screen window on the primary display.

element.name: SM_CYKANJIWINDOW
element.short: System metric index used to get the height for the Kanji window at the bottom of the screen on DBCS input systems.

element.name: SM_MOUSEPRESENT
element.short: System metric index used to determine whether a mouse (physical or virtual) is present on the system.

element.name: SM_CYVSCROLL
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for the arrow drawn on a vertical scroll bar.

element.name: SM_CXHSCROLL
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for the arrow drawn on a horizontal scroll bar.

element.name: SM_DEBUG
element.short: System metric index used to determine whether a debug version of User.exe is installed on the system.

element.name: SM_SWAPBUTTON
element.short: System metric index used to determine whether the actions for the left and right mouse buttons have been swapped.

element.name: SM_RESERVED1
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: SM_RESERVED2
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: SM_RESERVED3
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: SM_RESERVED4
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: SM_CXMIN
element.short: System metric index used to get the minimum width (in pixels) for a window.

element.name: SM_CYMIN
element.short: System metric index used to get the minimum height (in pixels) for a window.

element.name: SM_CXSIZE
element.short: System metric index used to get the width (in pixels) for a button displayed on a window caption or title bar.

element.name: SM_CYSIZE
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for a button displayed on a window caption or title bar.

element.name: SM_CXFRAME
element.short: Same as SM_CXSIZEFRAME.

element.name: SM_CYFRAME
element.short: Same as SM_CYSIZEFRAME.

element.name: SM_CXMINTRACK
element.short: System metric index used to get the minimum tracking width (in pixels) allowed when a window frame is resized.

element.name: SM_CYMINTRACK
element.short: System metric index used to get the minimum tracking height (in pixels) allowed when a window frame is resized.

element.name: SM_CXDOUBLECLK
element.short: System metric index used to get the width (in pixels) for the rectangle around the first mouse click in a double-click sequence. The second mouse click must be within the rectangle to be handled as a double-click event.

element.name: SM_CYDOUBLECLK
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for the rectangle around the first mouse click in a double-click sequence. The second mouse click must be within the rectangle to be handled as a double-click event.

element.name: SM_CXICONSPACING
element.short: System metric index used to get the width (in pixels) for an item displayed using the large icon view. SM_CXICON gets the minimum width.

element.name: SM_CYICONSPACING
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for an item displayed using the large icon view. SM_CYICON gets the minimum height.

element.name: SM_MENUDROPALIGNMENT
element.short: System metric index used to determine whether drop-down menu are aligned to the right on a menu bar. Returns 0 when left-aligned. Non-zero is right-aligned.

element.name: SM_PENWINDOWS
element.short: System metric index used to determine whether Pen computing extensions have been installed for the Windows platform.

element.name: SM_DBCSENABLED
element.short: System metric index used to determine whether DBCS input is supported on a Windows platform. Non-zero indicates that DBCS is supported.

element.name: SM_CMOUSEBUTTONS
element.short: System metric index used to get the number buttons available on the mouse. Returns 0 if a mouse is not installed.

element.name: SM_CXFIXEDFRAME
element.short: Same as SM_CXFIXEDFRAME.

element.name: SM_CYFIXEDFRAME
element.short: Same as SM_CYFIXEDFRAME.

element.name: SM_CXSIZEFRAME
element.short: Same as SM_CXSIZEFRAME.

element.name: SM_CYSIZEFRAME
element.short: System metric index used to get the thickness (in pixels) for the vertical border on a resizable window. Use SM_CXSIZEFRAME for the horizontal border. Has the same value as SM_CYFRAME.

element.name: SM_SECURE
element.short: Ignored. Do not use.

element.name: SM_CXEDGE
element.short: System metric index used to get the width (in pixels) for the border on a window. Returns the same value as SM_CXEDGE.

element.name: SM_CYEDGE
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for the border on a window. Returns the same value as SM_CXEDGE.

element.name: SM_CXMINSPACING
element.short: System metric index used to get the width (in pixels) for the rectangle around a minimized window. The value is used when minimized windows are arranged. SM_CXMINIMIZED gets the minimum width for a minimized window.

element.name: SM_CYMINSPACING
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for the rectangle around a minimized window. The value is used when minimized windows are arranged. SM_CYMINIMIZED gets the minimum height for a minimized window.

element.name: SM_CXSMICON
element.short: System metric index used to get the width (in pixels) for a small icon used on a window caption/title bar or in small icon view on a list view.

element.name: SM_CYSMICON
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for a small icon used on a window caption/title bar or in small icon view on a list view.

element.name: SM_CYSMCAPTION
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for a small caption.

element.name: SM_CXSMSIZE
element.short: System metric index used to get the width (in pixels) for a small caption button.

element.name: SM_CYSMSIZE
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for a small caption button.

element.name: SM_CXMENUSIZE
element.short: System metric index used to get the width (in pixels) for a menu bar button.

element.name: SM_CYMENUSIZE
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for a menu bar button.

element.name: SM_ARRANGE
element.short: System metric index used to determine how minimized windows are arranged. The return value contains OR'd values which indicate the starting position and direction.

element.name: SM_CXMINIMIZED
element.short: System metric index used to get the width (in pixels) for a minimized window.

element.name: SM_CYMINIMIZED
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for a minimized window.

element.name: SM_CXMAXTRACK
element.short: System metric index used to get the default maximum width (in pixels) for a window that has a caption and sizing borders. The return value refers to the width for the desktop.

element.name: SM_CYMAXTRACK
element.short: System metric index used to get the default maximum height (in pixels) for a window that has a caption and sizing borders. The return value refers to the height for the desktop.

element.name: SM_CXMAXIMIZED
element.short: System metric index used to get the width (in pixels) for a maximized top-level window on the primary display.

element.name: SM_CYMAXIMIZED
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for a maximized top-level window on the primary display.

element.name: SM_NETWORK
element.short: System metric index used to determine whether a network is present. Only the least significant bit in the return value is used; other bits are reserved. When set, a network is present.

element.name: SM_CLEANBOOT
element.short: System metric index used to determine whether a fail-safe boot mode was used to start the Windows system. 0 is Normal boot. 1 is Fail-Safe. 2 is Fail-Safe with Network.

element.name: SM_CXDRAG
element.short: System metric index used to get the number of horizontal pixels used as the threshold for starting a drag operation.

element.name: SM_CYDRAG
element.short: System metric index used to get the number of vertical pixels used as the threshold for starting a drag operation.

element.name: SM_SHOWSOUNDS
element.short: System metric index used to determine whether an application displays a visual indicator when it generates a sound. Returns a non-zero value when enabled.

element.name: SM_CXMENUCHECK
element.short: System metric index used to get the default width (in pixels) for the check mark bitmap drawn on a menu.

element.name: SM_CYMENUCHECK
element.short: System metric index used to get the default height (in pixels) for the check mark bitmap drawn on a menu.

element.name: SM_SLOWMACHINE
element.short: System metric index used to determine whether the system is quipped with a low-end (slow) processor. Returns a non-zero value when enabled.

element.name: SM_MIDEASTENABLED
element.short: System metric index used to determine whether the system uses Arabic or Hebrew languages. Returns a non-zero value when enabled.

element.name: SM_MOUSEWHEELPRESENT
element.short: System metric index used to determine whether a mouse with a vertical scroll wheel is installed. Returns a non-zero value when present.

element.name: SM_CMETRICS
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

descr.p: As an aside, the value is also defined in FPC units. Source comments indicate:

ul.li: The correct value for SM_CMETRICS for NT 3.5 is 75.
For Windows 95 and NT 4.0, it is 76.

element.name: SM_XVIRTUALSCREEN
element.short: System metric index used to get the left edge of the virtual screen represented by all of the display monitors on the system. SM_CXVIRTUALSCREEN gets the width for the virtual screen.

element.name: SM_YVIRTUALSCREEN
element.short: System metric index used to get the top edge of the virtual screen represented by all of the display monitors on the system. SM_CYVIRTUALSCREEN gets the height for the virtual screen.

element.name: SM_CXVIRTUALSCREEN
element.short: System metric index used to get the width (in pixels) for the virtual screen represented by all of the display monitors on the system. SM_XVIRTUALSCREEN gets the coordinate for the left edge on the virtual screen.

element.name: SM_CYVIRTUALSCREEN
element.short: System metric index used to get the height (in pixels) for the virtual screen represented by all of the display monitors on the system. SM_YVIRTUALSCREEN gets the coordinate for the top edge on the virtual screen.

element.name: SM_CMONITORS
element.short: System metric index used to get the numbers of visible displays attached to the system. It excludes pseudo-monitors associated with devices used for remote drawing or mirrored displays.

element.name: SM_SAMEDISPLAYFORMAT
element.short: System metric index used to determine whether all of the display monitors share the same color format (RGB pixel order and number of bits). A non-zero return value indicates the color format is shared on all monitors.

element.name: SM_SWSCROLLBARSPACING
element.short: Defined in the LCL to get the spacing used between a scroll bar and the content area for a control. Used in GTK and QT widgetsets.

element.name: SM_LCLMAXIMIZEDWIDTH
element.short: Defined to get accurate maximized window width under X11.

element.name: SM_LCLMAXIMIZEDHEIGHT
element.short: Defined to get accurate maximized height under X11.

element.name: SM_LCLHasFormAlphaBlend
element.short: Indicates if a form uses Alpha channel transparency.

element.name: SM_REMOTESESSION
element.short: System metric index used to determine if the calling process is a terminal services client session (non-zero return value) or a console session (zero return value). A console session does not have to be the physical console.

element.name: SPI_GETBEEP
element.short: Gets the state for warning beeps from system parameter information.

element.name: SPI_SETBEEP
element.short: Sets warning beeps on or off using system parameter information.

element.name: SPI_GETMOUSE
element.short: Gets mouse threshold and acceleration values from system parameter information.

element.name: SPI_SETMOUSE
element.short: Used to set the threshold and acceleration values for the mouse.

element.name: SPI_GETBORDER
element.short: Used to get a factor applied to sizing borders for a window.

element.name: SPI_SETBORDER
element.short: Used to set the factor applied to sizing borders for a window.

element.name: SPI_GETKEYBOARDSPEED
element.short: Used to get the keyboard repeat rate setting in the range 0 (approximately 2.5 repetitions per second) to 31 (approximately 30 repetitions per second).

element.name: SPI_SETKEYBOARDSPEED
element.short: Used to set the keyboard repeat rate. The value must be in the range 0 (approximately 2.5 repetitions per second) to 31 (approximately 30 repetitions per second).

element.name: SPI_LANGDRIVER
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: SPI_ICONHORIZONTALSPACING
element.short: Used to get or set the width (in pixels) for an icon displayed in the large icon view. SM_CXICON gets the minimum width for an icon.

element.name: SPI_GETSCREENSAVETIMEOUT
element.short: Used to get the time-out value (in seconds) for a screen saver.

element.name: SPI_SETSCREENSAVETIMEOUT
element.short: Used to set the time-out value (in seconds) for a screen saver.

element.name: SPI_GETSCREENSAVEACTIVE
element.short: Used to determine whether a screen saver is enabled. Return value is version-dependent. TRUE is normally enabled - except on Windows 7, Windows Server 2008, and Windows 2000 where TRUE is disabled.

element.name: SPI_SETSCREENSAVEACTIVE
element.short: Used to set the state for the screen saver. Parameter value TRUE activates the screen saver, and FALSE deactivates it.

element.name: SPI_GETGRIDGRANULARITY
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: SPI_SETGRIDGRANULARITY
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: SPI_SETDESKWALLPAPER
element.short: Used to indicate that the system wallpaper has been changed. The return value is TRUE unless an error was detected.

element.name: SPI_SETDESKPATTERN
element.short: Used to set the desktop pattern using the value read from the WIN.INI file.

element.name: SPI_GETKEYBOARDDELAY
element.short: Used to get the repeat-delay setting for the keyboard. The return value is in the range 0 (approximately 250 ms delay) to 3 (approximately 1 second delay). The actual delay rate is hardware-dependent.

element.name: SPI_SETKEYBOARDDELAY
element.short: Used to set the repeat-delay for the keyboard. The new value must be in the range 0 (approximately 250 ms delay) to 3 (approximately 1 second delay). The actual delay rate is hardware-dependent.

element.name: SPI_ICONVERTICALSPACING
element.short: Used to get or set the height (in pixels) for the cell where an icon is displayed. SM_CYICON gets the minimum icon height.

element.name: SPI_GETICONTITLEWRAP
element.short: Used to determine whether word wrapping for the caption text on an icon is enabled. Parameter value TRUE indicates word wrapping is enabled.

element.name: SPI_SETICONTITLEWRAP
element.short: Used set to enable or disable word wrapping of the caption text for an icon. Parameter value TRUE is enabled.

element.name: SPI_GETMENUDROPALIGNMENT
element.short: Used to determine whether a pop-up menu is left-aligned or right-aligned to its menu bar item. TRUE is right-aligned.

element.name: SPI_SETMENUDROPALIGNMENT
element.short: Used to set the alignment for a pop-up menu relative to its menu bar item. FALSE is left-aligned. TRUE is right-aligned.

element.name: SPI_SETDOUBLECLKWIDTH
element.short: Used to set the width (in pixels) for the rectangle around the first mouse click in a double-click sequence. The second mouse click must be within the rectangle to be handled as a double-click event.

element.name: SPI_SETDOUBLECLKHEIGHT
element.short: Used to set the height (in pixels) for the rectangle around the first mouse click in a double-click sequence. The second mouse click must be within the rectangle to be handled as a double-click event.

element.name: SPI_GETICONTITLELOGFONT
element.short: Used to get the logical font information for icon caption text. Used in the TWin32WidgetSet widgetset class.

element.name: SPI_SETDOUBLECLICKTIME
element.short: Used to set the mouse double-click time threshold. The parameter value contains the maximum number of milliseconds between mouse clicks treated as a double-click event. The maximum value for the setting is 5000 milliseconds (5 seconds).

element.name: SPI_SETMOUSEBUTTONSWAP
element.short: Used to swap or restore the actions performed for the left and right mouse buttons. The parameter value TRUE swaps the actions performed for the buttons. FALSE restores the original behavior.

element.name: SPI_SETICONTITLELOGFONT
element.short: Used to set the font used for icon caption text.

element.name: SPI_GETFASTTASKSWITCH
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: SPI_SETFASTTASKSWITCH
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: SPI_SETDRAGFULLWINDOWS
element.short: Used to enable or disable full window dragging. The parameter value TRUE enables full window dragging.

element.name: SPI_GETDRAGFULLWINDOWS
element.short: Used to get the enabled state for full window dragging. The return value TRUE indicates full window dragging is enabled.

element.name: SPI_GETNONCLIENTMETRICS
element.short: Used to get metrics for the non-client area on a visible window. The return value contains size and font information for the window, menu bar, status bar, borders, and fonts used on the window elements.

element.name: SPI_SETNONCLIENTMETRICS
element.short: Used to set metrics for the non-client area on a visible window. The parameter value contains size and font information for the window, menu bar, status bar, borders, and fonts applied to the window elements.

element.name: SPI_GETMINIMIZEDMETRICS
element.short: Used to get metrics for a minimized window. The return value includes information about the width of the minimized window and the arrange order, direction, and gaps between adjacent minimized windows.

element.name: SPI_SETMINIMIZEDMETRICS
element.short: Used to set metrics for a minimized window. The parameter value includes information about the width of the minimized window and the arrange order, direction, and gaps between adjacent minimized windows.

element.name: SPI_GETICONMETRICS
element.short: Used to get metrics for icons. The return value has information about horizontal and vertical icon spacing, word wrapping status and logical font information for caption text.

element.name: SPI_SETICONMETRICS
element.short: Used to set metrics for icons. The parameter value contains information about horizontal and vertical icon spacing, as well as word wrapping status and logical font information for caption text.

element.name: SPI_SETWORKAREA
element.short: Used to set the work area not obscured by the taskbar or desktop toolbars. The parameter value contains the display rectangle in virtual screen coordinates.

element.name: SPI_GETWORKAREA
element.short: Used to get the work area on the primary display not obscured by the taskbar or desktop toolbars. The return value contains the display rectangle in virtual screen coordinates.

element.name: SPI_SETPENWINDOWS
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: SPI_GETFILTERKEYS
element.short: Used to get information about the FilterKeys accessibility feature.

element.name: SPI_SETFILTERKEYS
element.short: Used to apply settings for the FilterKeys accessibility feature.

element.name: SPI_GETTOGGLEKEYS
element.short: Used to get information about the ToggleKeys accessibility feature.

element.name: SPI_SETTOGGLEKEYS
element.short: Used to apply settings for the ToggleKeys accessibility feature.

element.name: SPI_GETMOUSEKEYS
element.short: Used get information about the MouseKeys accessibility feature.

element.name: SPI_SETMOUSEKEYS
element.short: Used to apply settings for the MouseKeys accessibility feature.

element.name: SPI_GETSHOWSOUNDS
element.short: Used to determine whether Show Sounds accessibility flag is enabled. TRUE is enabled.

element.name: SPI_SETSHOWSOUNDS
element.short: Used to enabled or disable the Show Sounds Accessibility flag. TRUE is enabled.

element.name: SPI_GETSTICKYKEYS
element.short: Used to get information about the StickyKeys accessibility feature. The return value contains a set of bit-flags with the settings for the feature. Please note that numeric constants for these bit-flag values are not defined in the current LCL version.

element.name: SPI_SETSTICKYKEYS
element.short: Used to apply settings for the StickyKeys accessibility feature. The parameter value contains a set of bit-flags with the settings for the feature. Please note that numeric constants for these bit-flag values are not defined in the current LCL version.

element.name: SPI_GETACCESSTIMEOUT
element.short: Used to get information about the time-out period for accessibility features. The return value contains the time-out period (in milliseconds), and bit-flags for the enabled state and the audible notification setting.

element.name: SPI_SETACCESSTIMEOUT
element.short: Used to apply settings for the time-out period for accessibility features. The parameter value contains the time-out period (in milliseconds), and bit-flags to enable or disable the accessibility time-out feature and an audible notification for the condition.

element.name: SPI_GETSERIALKEYS
element.short: This parameter index is no longer supported in Windows. The feature can be controlled using the Control Panel.

element.name: SPI_SETSERIALKEYS
element.short: This parameter index is no longer supported in Windows. The feature can be controlled using the Control Panel.

element.name: SPI_GETSOUNDSENTRY
element.short: Used to get information about the SoundSentry accessibility feature. When enabled, a visual indication is displayed when a sound is generated.

element.name: SPI_SETSOUNDSENTRY
element.short: Used to apply settings for the SoundSentry accessibility feature. When enabled, a visual indication is displayed when a sound is generated.

element.name: SPI_GETHIGHCONTRAST
element.short: Used to get settings for the HighContrast accessibility feature. When enabled, the display theme is adjusted for maximum visibility for a visually-impaired user.

element.name: SPI_SETHIGHCONTRAST
element.short: Used to apply settings for the HighContrast accessibility feature. When enabled, the display theme is adjusted for maximum visibility for a visually-impaired user.

element.name: SPI_GETKEYBOARDPREF
element.short: Used to determine whether keyboard input and interfaces are used in place of mouse counterparts. TRUE when keyboard input is used.

element.name: SPI_SETKEYBOARDPREF
element.short: Used to apply settings for keyboard preference. TRUE indicates that keyboard input and interfaces are preferred to the mouse-based equivalents.

element.name: SPI_GETSCREENREADER
element.short: Used to determine whether a screen reader is active. The return value is TRUE if the screen reviewer is running.

element.name: SPI_SETSCREENREADER
element.short: Used to apply the flag which indicates whether a screen reader is active. TRUE indicates the screen reviewer is running.

element.name: SPI_GETANIMATION
element.short: Used to get the animation effects enabled for user actions, like minimize and restore animations.

element.name: SPI_SETANIMATION
element.short: Used to apply settings for the animation effects enabled for user actions, like minimize and restore animations.

element.name: SPI_GETFONTSMOOTHING
element.short: Used to determine whether font smoothing is enabled for the system. Font smoothing uses antialiasing to smooth curves using pixels with different shades of gray. TRUE is enabled.

element.name: SPI_SETFONTSMOOTHING
element.short: Used to apply the font smoothing setting for the system. Font smoothing uses antialiasing to smooth curves using pixels with different shades of gray. TRUE is enabled.

element.name: SPI_SETDRAGWIDTH
element.short: Used to set the width (in pixels) for the rectangle used to detect the start of a drag operation. The value is the number of horizontal pixels used as the threshold for the drag operation. The SM_CXDRAG system metric gets the existing drag width value.

element.name: SPI_SETDRAGHEIGHT
element.short: Used to set the height (in pixels) for the rectangle used to detect the start of a drag operation. The value is the number of vertical pixels used as the threshold for the drag operation. The SM_CYDRAG system metric gets the existing drag height value.

element.name: SPI_SETHANDHELD
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: SPI_GETLOWPOWERTIMEOUT
element.short: Used to get the time-out value the low-power condition in a screen saver. Supported for 32-bit applications on Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP/2000.

element.name: SPI_GETPOWEROFFTIMEOUT
element.short: Used to get the time-out value the power-off condition in a screen saver. Supported for 32-bit applications on Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP/2000.

element.name: SPI_SETLOWPOWERTIMEOUT
element.short: Used to set the time-out value (in seconds) for the low-power condition in a screen saver. Supported for 32-bit applications on Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP/2000.

element.name: SPI_SETPOWEROFFTIMEOUT
element.short: Used to set the time-out value (in seconds) for the power-off condition in a screen saver. Supported for 32-bit applications on Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP/2000.

element.name: SPI_GETLOWPOWERACTIVE
element.short: Used to determine whether the low-power condition is enabled for a screen saver. Supported for 32-bit applications on Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP/2000.

element.name: SPI_GETPOWEROFFACTIVE
element.short: Used to determine whether the power-off condition is enabled for a screen saver. Supported for 32-bit applications on Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP/2000.

element.name: SPI_SETLOWPOWERACTIVE
element.short: Used to enable or disable the low-power state for a screen saver. 1 to activate, or 0 to deactivate. Supported for 32-bit applications on Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP/2000.

element.name: SPI_SETPOWEROFFACTIVE
element.short: Used to enable or disable the power-off state for a screen saver. 1 to activate, or 0 to deactivate. Supported for 32-bit applications on Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP/2000.

element.name: SPI_SETCURSORS
element.short: Used to reload the system cursors.

element.name: SPI_SETICONS
element.short: Used to reload the system icons.

element.name: SPI_GETDEFAULTINPUTLANG
element.short: Used to get the default input language for the system.

element.name: SPI_SETDEFAULTINPUTLANG
element.short: Used to set the default input language for the system.

element.name: SPI_SETLANGTOGGLE
element.short: Used to set the hot keys which switch between input languages for the system.

element.name: SPI_GETWINDOWSEXTENSION
element.short: Not available in the SystemParametersInfo() API.

element.name: SPI_SETMOUSETRAILS
element.short: Used to enable or disable the Mouse Trails feature. Set the uiParam parameter to 0 or 1 to disable the feature. Use a value larger than 1 to enable the feature (a higher value results in a longer trail). Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_GETMOUSETRAILS
element.short: Used to determine whether the Mouse Trails feature is enabled. The pvParam parameter returns the state and length for the mouse trail. 0 or 1 is disabled. a value larger than 1 is the relative length for an enabled mouse trail (a higher value indicates a longer trail). Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_GETSNAPTODEFBUTTON
element.short: Used to determine whether the "Snap to Default Button" feature is enabled. The pvParam argument returns TRUE when enabled.

element.name: SPI_SETSNAPTODEFBUTTON
element.short: Used to enable or disable the "Snap to Default Button" feature. Set uiParam to TRUE to enable.

element.name: SPI_SCREENSAVERRUNNING
element.short: No longer available in SystemParametersInfo() API.

element.name: SPI_SETSCREENSAVERRUNNING
element.short: No longer available in SystemParametersInfo() API.

element.name: SPI_GETMOUSEHOVERWIDTH
element.short: Used to get the width (in pixels) for the rectangle with the bounds for a mouse hover event. pvParam returns the rectangle width.

element.name: SPI_SETMOUSEHOVERWIDTH
element.short: Used to set the width (in pixels) for the rectangle with the bounds for a mouse hover event. Use uiParam to set the width for the rectangle.

element.name: SPI_GETMOUSEHOVERHEIGHT
element.short: Used to get the height (in pixels) for the rectangle with the bounds for a mouse hover event. pvParam returns the rectangle height.

element.name: SPI_SETMOUSEHOVERHEIGHT
element.short: Used to set the height (in pixels) for the rectangle with the bounds for a mouse hover event. Use uiParam to set the height for the rectangle.

element.name: SPI_GETMOUSEHOVERTIME
element.short: Used to get the elapsed time (in milliseconds) within a hover rectangle before a mouse hover event is generated. pvParam contains the number of milliseconds for the hover time value.

element.name: SPI_SETMOUSEHOVERTIME
element.short: Used to set the elapsed time (in milliseconds) within a hover rectangle before a mouse hover event is generated. uiParam contains the number of milliseconds for the hover time value. Used when HOVER_DEFAULT is passed to TrackMouseEvent.

element.name: SPI_GETWHEELSCROLLLINES
element.short: Used to get the number of lines scrolled when the mouse wheel is moved. pvParam returns the unsigned Integer with the number of lines.

element.name: SPI_SETWHEELSCROLLLINES
element.short: Used to set the number of lines scrolled when the mouse wheel is moved. uiParam is the unsigned Integer with the suggested number of lines when modifier keys are not used. 0 prevents scrolling with the mouse wheel.

element.name: SPI_GETMENUSHOWDELAY
element.short: Used to get the delay time (in milliseconds) before the shortcut menu is displayed for a hovered menu item. pvParam returns the DWORD value for the delay time.

element.name: SPI_SETMENUSHOWDELAY
element.short: Used to set the delay time (in milliseconds) before the shortcut menu is displayed for a hovered menu item. Set uiParam to the DWORD value for the delay time.

element.name: SPI_GETSHOWIMEUI
element.short: Used to determine whether the IME status window is visible. pvParam returns TRUE when the IME window is visible.

element.name: SPI_SETSHOWIMEUI
element.short: Used to set the visibility for the IME status window. Set uiParam to TRUE to display the IME window.

element.name: SPI_GETMOUSESPEED
element.short: Used to get the relative pointer acceleration applied when the mouse is moved. pvParam contains the Integer value in the range 1 (slowest) to 20 (fastest).

element.name: SPI_SETMOUSESPEED
element.short: Used to set the relative pointer acceleration applied when the mouse is moved. uiParam is the Integer value for the mouse speed and must be in the range 1 (slowest) to 20 (fastest).

element.name: SPI_GETSCREENSAVERRUNNING
element.short: Used to determine whether the screen saver is running for a desktop session. pvParam is TRUE if a screen saver is running.

element.name: SPI_GETDESKWALLPAPER
element.short: Used to get the fully-qualified path to the image used as the desktop wallpaper. pvParam points to the buffer with the null-terminated path value, or an empty string if a desktop wallpaper is not used. Use uiParam to specify the size for the buffer in pvParam.

element.name: SPI_GETACTIVEWINDOWTRACKING
element.short: Used to determine whether active window tracking (focus follows mouse) is enabled or disabled. pvParam returns TRUE when enabled.

element.name: SPI_SETACTIVEWINDOWTRACKING
element.short: Used to enable or disable active window tracking (focus follows mouse). Set uiParam to TRUE to enable the feature.

element.name: SPI_GETMENUANIMATION
element.short: Used to determine whether the menu animation feature is enabled. pvParam is TRUE if menu animation is enabled. SPI_GETMENUFADE indicates if menus use fade or slide animations.

element.name: SPI_SETMENUANIMATION
element.short: Used to enable or disable the menu animation feature. Set pvParam to TRUE to enable menu animation. Use SPI_GETMENUFADE to control whether fade or slide animations are used.

element.name: SPI_GETCOMBOBOXANIMATION
element.short: Used to determine whether the slide-open animation effect is enabled for a combo-box. pvParam returns TRUE when the animation effect is enabled.

element.name: SPI_SETCOMBOBOXANIMATION
element.short: Used to enable or disable the slide-open animation effect for a combo-box. Set pvParam parameter to TRUE to enable the animation effect.

element.name: SPI_GETLISTBOXSMOOTHSCROLLING
element.short: Used to determine whether smooth scroll is enabled or disabled in list box controls. pvParam returns TRUE when smooth scroll is enabled.

element.name: SPI_SETLISTBOXSMOOTHSCROLLING
element.short: Used to enable or disable smooth scroll in list box controls. Set pvParam to TRUE to enable smooth scroll.

element.name: SPI_GETGRADIENTCAPTIONS
element.short: Used to determine whether a gradient is drawn in window title bars. pvParam returns TRUE if the gradient effect is enabled.

element.name: SPI_SETGRADIENTCAPTIONS
element.short: Used to enable or disable the gradient effect in window title bars. Set pvParam to TRUE to enabled the gradient effect on displays with a color depth larger than 256 colors.

element.name: SPI_GETKEYBOARDCUES
element.short: Used to determine whether menu access keys are drawn as accelerator keys (underlined). pvParam returns TRUE when menu access keys are underlined, and FALSE if the underline appears after the menu has been activated.

element.name: SPI_SETKEYBOARDCUES
element.short: Used to enable or disable drawing of menu access keys as accelerator keys (underlined). Set pvParam to TRUE when menu access keys are always underlined, and FALSE if the underline appears after the menu has been activated using the keyboard.

element.name: SPI_GETMENUUNDERLINES
element.short: Same as SPI_GETKEYBOARDCUES.

element.name: SPI_SETMENUUNDERLINES
element.short: Same as Same as SPI_SETKEYBOARDCUES.

element.name: SPI_GETACTIVEWNDTRKZORDER
element.short: Used to determine whether windows activated by window tracking are brought to the top of the display order (Z-axis). pvParam returns TRUE when enabled.

element.name: SPI_SETACTIVEWNDTRKZORDER
element.short: Used to enable or disable changes to the Z-order for windows activated using window tracking. Set pvParam to TRUE to bring a tracking activated window to the top of the display order (Z-axis).

element.name: SPI_GETHOTTRACKING
element.short: Used to determine whether hot-tracking (or hot-lighting) is enabled for UI elements. pvParam returns TRUE if hot-tracking is enabled.

element.name: SPI_SETHOTTRACKING
element.short: Used to enable or disable hot-tracking (or hot-lighting) for UI elements. Set pvParam to TRUE to enable hot-tracking.

element.name: SPI_GETMENUFADE
element.short: Used to determine whether the menu fade animation effect is enabled. pvParam returns TRUE if the animation effect is enabled. When set to FALSE, the menu slide animation effect is used instead. Neither animation effect is displayed when SPI_SETMENUANIMATION is disabled.

element.name: SPI_SETMENUFADE
element.short: Used to enable or disable the the menu fade animation effect on displays using a color depth higher than 256. Set pvParam to TRUE to enable the menu fade animation effect. Set pvParam to FALSE to enable the menu slide animation effect instead. Use SPI_SETMENUANIMATION to enable or disable all animation effects.

element.name: SPI_GETSELECTIONFADE
element.short: Used to determine whether the selection fade effect is enabled. pvParam returns TRUE if the animation effect is enabled.

element.name: SPI_SETSELECTIONFADE
element.short: Used to enable or disable the selection fade effect for menu items on displays with a color depth higher than 256 colors. Set pvParam to TRUE to enable the selection fade effect.

element.name: SPI_GETTOOLTIPANIMATION
element.short: Used to determine whether ToolTip animation is enabled. pvParam returns TRUE if the the animation effect is enabled. Use SPI_GETTOOLTIPFADE to control whether fade or slide animation effects are used for ToolTip animations.

element.name: SPI_SETTOOLTIPANIMATION
element.short: Used to enable or disable ToolTip animation effects. Set pvParam to TRUE to enable ToolTip animations. Use SPI_SETTOOLTIPFADE to specify whether the fade or slide animation effect is used.

element.name: SPI_GETTOOLTIPFADE
element.short: Used to determine whether a ToolTip animation uses a fade effect or a slide effect. pvParam return TRUE for the fade effect, or FALSE for the slide effect. Use SPI_SETTOOLTIPANIMATION to enable or disable ToolTip animation effects.

element.name: SPI_SETTOOLTIPFADE
element.short: Used to indicate whether a ToolTip animation uses a fade effect or a slide effect. Set pvParam to TRUE to use the fade animation or FALSE to use the slide animation. Use SPI_SETTOOLTIPANIMATION to enable or disable ToolTip animation effects.

element.name: SPI_GETCURSORSHADOW
element.short: Used to determine whether the cursor is displayed with a shadow. pvParam returns TRUE if the shadow is enabled. Shown on displays with a color depth larger than 256 colors.

element.name: SPI_SETCURSORSHADOW
element.short: Used to enable or disable a shadow for the cursor. Set pvParam to TRUE to enable the cursor shadow. Shown on displays with a color depth larger than 256 colors.

element.name: SPI_GETUIEFFECTS
element.short: Used to determine whether UI effects are enabled or disabled. pvParam returns TRUE if UI effects are enabled.

element.name: SPI_SETUIEFFECTS
element.short: Used to enable or disable UI effects. Set pvParam to TRUE to enable UI effects.

element.name: SPI_GETFOREGROUNDLOCKTIMEOUT
element.short: Used to get the time (in milliseconds) before an application can be brought to the foreground. pvParam is the DWORD variable with the time value.

element.name: SPI_SETFOREGROUNDLOCKTIMEOUT
element.short: Used to set the time (in milliseconds) before an application can be brought to the foreground. Set pvParam to the DWORD value with the time delay.

element.name: SPI_GETACTIVEWNDTRKTIMEOUT
element.short: Used to get the delay time (in milliseconds) before active window tracking is engaged. pvParam is the DWORD value for the delay time.

element.name: SPI_SETACTIVEWNDTRKTIMEOUT
element.short: Used to set the delay time (in milliseconds) before active window tracking is engaged. pvParam is the DWORD value with the new delay time.

element.name: SPI_GETFOREGROUNDFLASHCOUNT
element.short: Used to get the number of times a task bar button is flashed when a foreground switch request is rejected. pvParam returns the DWORD value for the flash count.

element.name: SPI_SETFOREGROUNDFLASHCOUNT
element.short: Used to set the number of times a task bar button is flashed when a foreground switch request is rejected. Set pvParam to the DWORD value with the number of flashes.

element.name: SPI_GETCARETWIDTH
element.short: Used to get the width (in pixels) for the caret in an edit control. pvParam returns the DWORD value with the caret width.

element.name: SPI_SETCARETWIDTH
element.short: Used to set the width (in pixels) for the caret in an edit control. Set pvParam to the DWORD value with the caret width. The default value is 1 pixel.

element.name: SPI_GETMOUSESONAR
element.short: Used to determine whether the Mouse Sonar feature is enabled. pvParam returns TRUE if the feature is enabled.

element.name: SPI_SETMOUSESONAR
element.short: Used to enable or disable the Mouse Sonar feature. Set pvParam to TRUE to enable the feature, or FALSE to disable the feature.

element.name: SPI_GETMOUSECLICKLOCK
element.short: Used to determine whether the Mouse Click Lock feature is enabled. pvParam returns TRUE if mouse clicks are locked until the timeout has elapsed, or FALSE when unlocked. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_SETMOUSECLICKLOCK
element.short: Used to enable or disable the Mouse Click Lock feature. Set pvParam to TRUE to prevent mouse clicks until the timeout period has elapsed, or FALSE to disable the feature. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_GETMOUSEVANISH
element.short: Used to determine whether the Mouse Vanish feature is enabled or disabled. pvParam returns TRUE if the feature is enabled. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_SETMOUSEVANISH
element.short: Used to enable or disable the Mouse Vanish feature. Set pvParam to TRUE to enable the feature. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_GETFLATMENU
element.short: Used to determine whether native User menus have a flat appearance. pvParam returns TRUE if menus are displayed using the flat style. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_SETFLATMENU
element.short: Used to enable or disable display of native User menus using a flat appearance. Set pvParam to TRUE to enable use of the flat drawing style. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_GETDROPSHADOW
element.short: Used to determine whether the drop shadow effect is enabled or disabled in the user interface. pvParam returns TRUE if drop shadows are enabled. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_SETDROPSHADOW
element.short: Used to enable or disable the drop shadow effect in the user interface. Set pvParam to TRUE to enable the drop shadow effect. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_GETBLOCKSENDINPUTRESETS
element.short: Used determine whether an application can reset the screensaver time. pvParam returns TRUE if SendInput cannot be used to send an input request, or FALSE when unblocked.

element.name: SPI_SETBLOCKSENDINPUTRESETS
element.short: Used to control whether an application can reset the screensaver time. Set uiParam to TRUE to prevent SendInput from deactivating the screensaver, or FALSE if the screensaver is deactivated by SendInput.

element.name: SPI_GETMOUSECLICKLOCKTIME
element.short: Used to get the time delay (in milliseconds) before the primary mouse button is locked. pvParam returns the DWORD value with the delay time. Enabled when SPI_SETMOUSECLICKLOCK is set to TRUE. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_SETMOUSECLICKLOCKTIME
element.short: Used to set the time delay (in milliseconds) before the primary mouse button is locked. Set pvParam to the DWORD value with the delay time. Enabled when SPI_SETMOUSECLICKLOCK is set to TRUE. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_GETFONTSMOOTHINGTYPE
element.short: Used to get the font smoothing enabled for the system. pvParam returns either FE_FONTSMOOTHINGSTANDARD or FE_FONTSMOOTHINGCLEARTYPE in the UINT value. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_SETFONTSMOOTHINGTYPE
element.short: Used to set the font smoothing enabled for the system. Set pvParam to either FE_FONTSMOOTHINGSTANDARD or FE_FONTSMOOTHINGCLEARTYPE. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_GETFONTSMOOTHINGCONTRAST
element.short: Used to get the contrast value for ClearType font smoothing. pvParam returns a UINT value in the range 1000 to 2200. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_SETFONTSMOOTHINGCONTRAST
element.short: Used to set the contrast value for ClearType font smoothing. Set pvParam to a UINT value in the range 1000 to 2200. Used when SPI_SETFONTSMOOTHINGTYPE is set to FE_FONTSMOOTHINGCLEARTYPE. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_GETFOCUSBORDERWIDTH
element.short: Used to get the width (in pixels) for the top or bottom edges on the focus rectangle drawn in DrawFocusRect. pvParam returns the UINT value with the new width for the border. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_SETFOCUSBORDERWIDTH
element.short: Used to set the width (in pixels) for the top or bottom edges on the focus rectangle drawn in DrawFocusRect. Set pvParam to the new width for the border. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_GETFOCUSBORDERHEIGHT
element.short: Used to get the height (in pixels) for the top or bottom edges on the focus rectangle drawn in DrawFocusRect. pvParam returns the height for the border. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_SETFOCUSBORDERHEIGHT
element.short: Used to set the height (in pixels) for the top or bottom edges on the focus rectangle drawn in DrawFocusRect. Set pvParam to the new height for the border. Not supported on Windows 2000.

element.name: SPI_GETFONTSMOOTHINGORIENTATION
element.short: Used to get the orientation used for font smoothing (RGB or BGR orientation).

element.name: SPI_SETFONTSMOOTHINGORIENTATION
element.short: Used to set the orientation used for font smoothing (RGB or BGR orientation).

element.name: BI_RGB
element.short: Bit-flag for the uncompressed Red/Green/Blue (RGB) compression format used in bitmap images. Indicates the image data is not compressed and does not use color masks.

element.name: BI_RLE8
element.short: Bit-flag for the Red/Green/Blue (RGB) color format using 8-bits per pixel run-length encoding (RLE) compression format in a bitmap image. Indicates that the image data contains a 2-byte RLE format with count and color index values.

element.name: BI_RLE4
element.short: Bit-flag for the Red/Green/Blue (RGB) color format using 4-bits per pixel run-length encoding (RLE) compression format in a bitmap image. Indicates that the image data contains a 2 byte RLE format with a count byte and two word-sized color index values.

element.name: BI_BITFIELDS
element.short: Bit-flag for the uncompressed Red/Green/Blue (RGB) color format using three DWORD values for the red, green, and blue components (respectively) for each pixel in the image data. Valid for both 16-bit and 32-bit per pixel bitmaps.

element.name: HORZSIZE
element.short: Horizontal size in millimeters.

element.name: VERTSIZE
element.short: Vertical size in millimeters.

element.name: HORZRES
element.short: Horizontal width in pixels for a device context.

element.name: VERTRES
element.short: Vertical height in pixels for a device context.

element.name: BITSPIXEL
element.short: Number of bits per pixel.

element.name: PLANES
element.short: Number of color planes.

element.name: LOGPIXELSX
element.short: The number of pixels per logical inch, in X (horizontal) direction.

element.name: LOGPIXELSY
element.short: The number of pixels per logical inch, in Y (vertical) direction.

element.name: SIZEPALETTE
element.short: Number of entries in the color palette.

element.name: NUMRESERVED
element.short: Number of reserved entries in the color palette.

element.name: TA_NOUPDATECP
element.short: Suppresses update of the current position after each text output call.

element.name: TA_UPDATECP
element.short: Enables update of the current position after each text output call.

element.name: TA_LEFT
element.short: Enables left alignment of text to the bounds rectangle.

element.name: TA_RIGHT
element.short: Enables right alignment of text to the bounds rectangle.

element.name: TA_CENTER
element.short: Enables horizontal alignment of text to the center of the bounds rectangle.

element.name: TA_TOP
element.short: Enables vertical alignment of text to the top of the bounds rectangle.

element.name: TA_BOTTOM
element.short: Enables vertical alignment of text to the bottom of the bounds rectangle.

element.name: TA_BASELINE
element.short: Places the reference point on the baseline for the text.

element.name: TA_RTLREADING
element.short: Enables right-to-left reading order when the selected font is either Arabic or Hebrew.

element.name: TA_MASK
element.short: Not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: TResourceType
element.short: Platform-specific alias for resource type identifiers in LCL.

element.name: RT_CURSOR
element.short: Identifier for a Cursor resource type.

element.name: RT_BITMAP
element.short: Identifier for a Bitmap resource type.

element.name: RT_ICON
element.short: Identifier for an Icon resource type.

element.name: RT_MENU
element.short: Identifier for a Menu resource type.

element.name: RT_DIALOG
element.short: Identifier for a Dialog resource type.

element.name: RT_STRING
element.short: Identifier for a String resource type.

element.name: RT_FONTDIR
element.short: Identifier for a Font directory resource type.

element.name: RT_FONT
element.short: Identifier for a Font resource type.

element.name: RT_ACCELERATOR
element.short: Identifier for an Accelerator resource type.

element.name: RT_RCDATA
element.short: Identifier for an Application-defined resource type (raw data).

element.name: RT_MESSAGETABLE
element.short: Identifier for a Message Table resource type.

element.name: RT_GROUP_CURSOR
element.short: Identifier for a Hardware-independent Cursor resource type.

element.name: RT_GROUP_ICON
element.short: Identifier for a Hardware-independent Icon resource type.

element.name: RT_VERSION
element.short: Identifier for a Version resource type.

element.name: RT_ANICURSOR
element.short: Identifier for an animated Cursor resource type.

element.name: RT_ANIICON
element.short: Identifier for an animated Icon resource type.

element.name: RT_HTML
element.short: Identifier for an HTML resource type.

element.name: RT_MANIFEST
element.short: Identifier for a Side-by-Side Assembly Manifest resource type.

element.name: IMAGE_BITMAP
element.short: Identifies a Bitmap image type.

element.name: IMAGE_ICON
element.short: Identifies an Icon image type.

element.name: IMAGE_CURSOR
element.short: Identifies a Cursor image type.

element.name: IMAGE_ENHMETAFILE
element.short: Identifies an Enhanced Metafile image type.

element.name: TFarProc
element.short: Alias to the Pointer type.

element.name: TFNWndProc
element.short: Alias to the TFarProc type.

element.name: PLogFontA
element.short: Defines a Pointer to the TLogFontA type.

element.name: PLogFontW
element.short: Defines a Pointer to the TLogFontW type.

element.name: PLogFont
element.short: Alias to the PLogFontA type.

element.name: LOGFONTA
element.short: Alias to the Windows.LogFont type. Defined for the Windows platform.

element.name: LOGFONTW
element.short: Alias to the Windows.LogFontW type. Defined for the Windows platform.

element.name: LOGFONTA.lfHeight
element.short: Height (in logical units) for a character in the font.

element.name: LOGFONTA.lfWidth
element.short: Width (in logical units) for a character in the font.

element.name: LOGFONTA.lfEscapement
element.short: The angle (in tenths of a degree) between the escapement vector and the x-axis of the device.

element.name: LOGFONTA.lfOrientation
element.short: The angle (in tenths of a degree) between the base line for a character and the x-axis of the device.

element.name: LOGFONTA.lfWeight
element.short: The weight for the font in the range 0..1000. 400 is normal and 700 is bold. 0 causes a default font weight to be used.

element.name: PLogBrush
element.short: Pointer to the TLogBrush type.

element.name: tagLOGBRUSH
element.short: Description of a Brush.

descr.p: A brush has a color and a pattern.
The content of lbColor and lbHatch varies, depending on lbStyle.
When a drawing function fills an area, using the current brush, a BS_HOLLOW brush can be used to suppress filling.

element.name: tagLOGBRUSH.lbStyle
element.short: The brush style, e.g. BS_SOLID or BS_HATCHED.

element.name: tagLOGBRUSH.lbColor
element.short: The brush color, a TColorRef for BS_SOLID or BS_HATCHED.

element.name: tagLOGBRUSH.lbHatch
element.short: Polymorphic, depending on lbStyle. With style BS_HATCHED lbHatch is a pattern constant, e.g. HS_VERTICAL.

element.name: TNewTextMetric
element.short: Record type used to store text metrics for supported LCL platforms.

element.name: PWndClassExA
element.short: Pointer to the TWndClassExA type.

element.name: PWndClassExW
element.short: Pointer to the TWndClassExW type.

element.name: PWndClassEx
element.short: Alias for the PWndClassExA type.

element.name: TCreateParams
element.short: Record type used to store window creation parameters.

element.name: TIconInfo
element.short: Structure used to store the hot spot coordinates, color, and mask for an Icon.

element.name: TTimerProc
element.short: Defines a procedure used as a callback to process timer messages.

element.name: TClipboardFormat
element.short: Alias for the PtrUInt type.

descr.p: TClipboardFormat is the type passed as an argument to TClipboardRequestEvent event handlers, and to routines in the graphics and clipbrd units.

element.name: PClipboardFormat
element.short: Pointer to a TClipboardFormat type.

element.name: TClipboardRequestEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled to get a stream instance with the data for a given clipboard format.

descr.p: TClipboardRequestEvent is the type used to represent an event handler procedure for clipboard requests in widgetset classes. It is the type used to implement the OnRequest event handler in TClipboard.

element.name: TClipboardType
element.short: Represents the sources or dispositions for clipboard data.

descr.p: Used for platforms / window managers / desktop environments that support more than one clipboard. It appears to be inherently tied to the ICCCM protocol developed by freedesktop.org. Values in the enumeration are used in widgetset classes as an index to access the different clipboard storage areas/formats.

element.name: TClipboardType.ctPrimarySelection
element.short: The clipboard is the one designated as PRIMARY for the desktop. Implies that it is used for commands that accept a single argument. Historically, it is used for mouse selections, pasting using the middle mouse button, and explicit cut/copy/paste operations initiated from a menu item.

element.name: TClipboardType.ctSecondarySelection
element.short: The clipboard is the one designated as SECONDARY for the desktop. Implies that it is used to exchange values for primary and secondary selections.

element.name: TClipboardType.ctClipboard
element.short: This is the clipboard type when the desktop does not support multiple clipboards, or when copy/cut and paste operations are performed between different clients.

element.name: ClipboardTypeName
element.short: Contains the names associated with the clipboard types accessed using the enumeration values.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat
element.short: Represents predefined clipboard formats used in the LCL.

descr.p: Values in the enumeration indicates the type of content stored on the clipboard. Values from the enumeration are passed as an argument to routines in the LCL interface, and used in the implementation of widgetset classes.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat.pcfText
element.short: Clipboard contains plain text.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat.pcfBitmap
element.short: Clipboard contains an image using the .BMP or Bitmap format.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat.pcfPixmap
element.short: Clipboard contains an image using the PixMap format.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat.pcfIcon
element.short: Clipboard contains an image using the .ico or Icon format.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat.pcfPicture
element.short: Clipboard contains an image using the TPicture format.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat.pcfObject
element.short: Clipboard contains an object (TObject) instance.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat.pcfComponent
element.short: Clipboard contains a component (TComponent) instance.

element.name: TPredefinedClipboardFormat.pcfCustomData
element.short: Clipboard contains data stored using an application-specific custom format.

element.name: PredefinedClipboardMimeTypes
element.short: Contains MIME types for the values in the TPredefinedClipboardFormat enumeration.

element.name: TListChangeEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled when a value in a TListWithEvent instance is modified.

descr.p: TListChangeEvent is the type used for the OnChange event handler property in TListWithEvent.

element.name: TListChangeEvent.Ptr
element.short: An untyped Pointer to the modified list item for the event.

element.name: TListChangeEvent.AnAction
element.short: Indicates the action performed for the list item that caused the notification event.

element.name: TListWithEvent
element.short: Implements a list with an event signalled when values are added or removed.

descr.p: TListWithEvent is a TList descendant which implements a list with an event handler signalled when values are added to or removed from the container. It provides an overridden Notify method which signals the event handler (when assigned) for add or delete operations. Assign an object procedure using the signature in TListChangeEvent to the OnChange event handler to respond to the notification.

element.name: TListWithEvent.FOnChange
element.short: Member used for the OnChange event handler.

element.name: TListWithEvent.Notify
element.short: Handles the notification when a value is added to or removed from the list.

descr.p: Notify is an overridden method in TListWithEvent. It calls the inherited method to notify registered observers of the change to the list. It signals the OnChange event handler (when assigned) using the values in Ptr and AnAction as arguments.

element.name: TListWithEvent.Notify.Ptr
element.short: Untyped pointer to the value for the notification.

element.name: TListWithEvent.Notify.AnAction
element.short: Operation performed for the specified value.

element.name: TListWithEvent.OnChange
element.short: Event handler signalled when a value is added to or removed from the list.

descr.p: Signalled from the Notify method (when assigned).

element.short: Component style identifier. Used for non-LCL controls that create their own handles.

element.name: MK_LBUTTON
element.short: A key state constant to represent the left mouse button, equivalent to ssLeft from TShiftState.

element.name: MK_RBUTTON
element.short: A key state constant to represent the right mouse button, equivalent to ssRight from TShiftState.

element.name: MK_SHIFT
element.short: A key state constant to represent the shift key, equivalent to ssShift from TShiftState.

element.name: MK_CONTROL
element.short: A key state constant to represent the control key, equivalent to ssCtrl from TShiftState.

element.name: MK_MBUTTON
element.short: A key state constant to represent the middle mouse button, equivalent to ssMiddle from TShiftState.

element.name: MK_XBUTTON1
element.short: A key state constant to represent the first extra mouse button, equivalent to ssExtra1 from TShiftState.

element.name: MK_XBUTTON2
element.short: A key state constant to represent the second extra mouse button, equivalent to ssExtra2 from TShiftState.

element.name: LVN_ITEMCHANGING
element.short: List View notification message code for a pending change to an item.

element.name: LVN_ITEMCHANGED
element.short: List View notification message code for a completed change to an item.

element.name: PNMListView
element.short: Pointer to the TNMListView type.

element.name: TNMListView
element.short: Record type used for List View change notification messages.

element.name: _NM_LISTVIEW
element.short: Alias for the TNMListView type.

element.name: NM_LISTVIEW
element.short: Alias for the TNMListView type.

element.name: tagNMLISTVIEW
element.short: Alias for the TNMListView type.

element.name: TStockFont
element.short: Represents stock font types used in InitStockFont.

descr.p: Values in the enumeration are passed as an argument to the InitStockFont routine in the LCL interface, and used when a widgetset class calls its InitStockFont method.

element.name: TStockFont.sfSystem
element.short: Represents the stock system font.

element.name: TStockFont.sfHint
element.short: Represents the stock hint font.

element.name: TStockFont.sfIcon
element.short: Represents the stock icon font.

element.name: TStockFont.sfMenu
element.short: Represents the stock menu font.

element.name: CS_To_String
element.short: Converts a component style identifier to a component style name.

descr.p: The following values are not supported in the CompStyle argument, and cause 'Unknown component style' to be returned from the routine:
Not used in the current LCL implementation.

element.name: CS_To_String.Result
element.short: String representing the component style, or 'Unknown component style' for unsupported values.

element.name: CS_To_String.CompStyle
element.short: Integer component style identifier converted to its representation as a String.

element.name: HiWord
element.short: Gets the largest value for the specified Integer as a Word type.

element.name: HiWord.Result
element.short: Largest Word value for the specified Integer.

element.name: HiWord.i
element.short: Integer value examined in the routine.

element.name: LoWord
element.short: Gets the smallest value for the specified Integer as a Word type.

element.name: LoWord.Result
element.short: Smallest Word value for the specified Integer.

element.name: LoWord.i
element.short: Integer value examined in the routine.

element.name: Char2VK
element.short: Gets the virtual key code for the specified character value.

descr.p: The return value is 0 (zero) if the character in C is not an alphanumeric character in the ranges '0'..'9', 'a'..'z', or 'A'..'Z'.

element.name: Char2VK.Result
element.short: Virtual key code for the specified value.

element.name: Char2VK.C
element.short: Character value examined in the routine.

element.name: VK2Char
element.short: Gets the character value for the specified virtual key code.

element.name: VK2Char.Result
element.short: Character value for the specified virtual key code.

element.name: VK2Char.AVK
element.short: Virtual key code converted to a character in the routine.

element.name: MathRound
element.short: Rounds the specified Real value to an Int64 value.

element.name: MathRound.Result
element.short: Int64 type with the rounded value.

element.name: MathRound.AValue
element.short: Real type with the value rounded in the routine.

element.name: MulDiv
element.short: Multiples the numerator by the specified Integer value, and divides the result by the denominator value.

descr.p: Values passed in the arguments to the routine are Integer types. Values in nNumber and nNumerator are cast to Int64 values for the multiplication operation. MathRound is called to ensure that the result for the division operation is rounded for the Int64 type, and is cast to the Integer type used in the return value.
When nNumerator and nDenominator have the same value, the return value is set to nNumber. The return value is -1 if the value in nDenominator is 0 (zero).

element.name: MulDiv.Result
element.short: Integer result for the multiply and divide operations.

element.name: MulDiv.nNumber
element.short: Multiplicand for the operation.

element.name: MulDiv.nNumerator
element.short: Numerator multiplied by the specified value.

element.name: MulDiv.nDenominator
element.short: Denominator used for the division operation.

element.name: KeyToShortCut
element.short: Gets the short cut value for the specified key code and shift modifiers.

descr.p: The return value is determined by combining the value in Key with the Shift, Ctrl, Alt, or Meta modifiers in Shift. The return value is 0 if any of the high-order bits in Key are already set.

element.name: KeyToShortCut.Result
element.short: TShortCut value for the specified key code and shift modifier.

element.name: KeyToShortCut.Key
element.short: Key code for the short cut value.

element.name: KeyToShortCut.Shift
element.short: Shift, Ctrl, Alt, or Meta modifier for the short cut value.

element.name: CharSetToString
element.short: Gets a String with the name for the specified character set identifier.

element.name: CharSetToString.Result
element.short: Character set name for the specified identifier.

element.name: CharSetToString.Charset
element.short: Character set identifier converted to a name in the routine.

element.name: StringToCharset
element.short: Gets the character set identifier for the specified character set name.

element.name: StringToCharset.Result
element.short: Constant with the character set identifier for the specified character set name.

element.name: StringToCharset.Charset
element.short: Character set name converted to its identifier constant.
